parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the stator can cause the motorcycle to lose power, stall, or become uncontrollable, which can lead to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: vehicle dying and being able to be restarted
loss of power and regaining full power intermittently.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the steering head bearings can cause the front wheel to wobble violently, leading to a loss of control and increased risk of accidents, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: The front wheel wobbles or shakes violently
the handlebars vibrate or shake from side to side
the motorcycle is difficult to control or steer
the rider experiences a loss of confidence or safety while riding.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear rotor rivets can cause the rotor to work its way loose, leading to a loss of braking power, which can increase the risk of accidents and injuries.
symptoms: the rear rotor rivets come loose
the vehicle experiences reduced braking power
the vehicle is difficult to control
especially during turns or when braking.
